wikipedia_page.main: John Divers (8 March 1940 – 23 September 2014) was a Scottish footballer who played for Celtic and Partick Thistle.

response: *John Divers Sr. and John Divers Jr. (Celtic)

Two of his sons Tommy and Willie also became footballers, as did his grandsons Brian and Kevin, the latter of whom played for Scotland at 1998 FIFA World Cup. Additionally, his nephew John Divers and John's son of the same name both played for Celtic.
* 23 September: John Divers, Scottish footballer (born 1940)
John Divers may refer to:
*John Divers (footballer, born 1873), Scottish international footballer who played for Hibernian, Celtic and Everton
*John Divers (footballer, born 1911), Scottish international footballer who played for Celtic, Morton and Oldham
*John Divers (footballer, born 1931), footballer who played in Clyde's Scottish Cup winning side of 1954–1955 and later for Exeter City and East Stirlingshire
*John Divers (footballer, born 1940), son of the footballer born 1911, played for Celtic and Partick Thistle

He is the grandson of the late Celtic forward Patsy Gallacher, who died before he was born. His uncles Willie and Tommy and cousin Brian were also footballers. The Gallachers are also related to another footballing branch of the family, John Divers and his son of the same name who both played for Celtic.

*John Divers, 74, Scottish footballer.Scottish football: Former Celtic striker John Divers has died aged 74

Tommy's first born child, Brian Gallacher, also played football professionally for Dumbarton, Kilmarnock, St Mirren, Partick Thistle and Albion Rovers. The Gallachers are also related to another footballing branch of the family, John Divers and his son of the same name who both played for Celtic.
*  Patsy Gallacher, Willie Gallacher (son), Tommy Gallacher (son), John Divers Sr. (nephew), Brian Gallacher (grandson, son of Tommy), Kevin Gallacher (grandson), John Divers Jr. (great-nephew)

This squad nucleus won the 1965–66 Scottish Division One title and the 1965–66 Scottish League Cup with a win over Rangers, though they lost to the same opponents in the 1966 Scottish Cup Final after a replay and were narrowly eliminated from the Cup Winners' Cup at the semi-final stage.
